alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 1:26PM CDT until March 27 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT/330 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Henry. In southwest Georgia, Early. * WHEN...Until 230 PM CDT /330 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM CDT /226 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abbeville, Headland, Newville, Haleburg, Balkum, Tumbleton, Dancey, Miller, Grandberry Crossroads, Capps, Headland Municipal A/P, Hardwickburg, Barnes, Willis Crossroads, Hayes, Blackwood, Kirkland Crossroads and Shorterville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
